comment: Blumentritt was awesome! Terrific lectures, and he does a good job of reviewing previously discussed material before each new lecture. And he doesn't just read from a PPT, which is so refreshing. Your grade is based on application quizzes and case study papers. Due diligence in reading, researching, and writing is vital to do well in this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Grading is a little nit picky but overall Blumentritt is a good professor. This is a real critical thinking class that translates well into the corporate world. The text quizzes are easy, right from the book; focus most attention on the written assignments - those are more intense (& where the tediousness comes in). You get used to his structure.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Blumentritt always gives good general feedback on the application quizzes and provides examples so you know how to improve for next time. He is a very caring professor and wants his students to succeed! There is a good bit of writing in the class, but the more you do it, the more you get used to it.

No exams in this class which is great!!! It is mostly based on participation and how well you can implement the information you learn in class to discussions and case studies. If you attend class you will be more than fine. I definitely recommend taking him as his discussions are fun and informative.

Summer Semester:
2 Quizzes/week
1 500 word paper/week
2 2000 word papers

Took this class as a capstone for the Bachelor's program. Prof. Blumentritt's expectations are very different from what I'd experienced up to this point, which I found valuable personally. He expects professionalism in our writing and returns it with well-thought feedback.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: 10+ discussion posts due AT A TIME (to receive a B). VERY unclear grading rubric & said in an email "no one is perfect, so therefore it's extremely hard to get an A in my class, even if you try really hard & do extra work." Expect a TON of discussion posts, 2 quizzes every other week, and 2 case studies. CAPSIM is awful and very time consuming!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He is a tough grader, but that's to be expected. All the assignments are due at the end of the semester, so you won't know exactly how well you're doing until the end, though we did take the final exam a month before the semester ended. He may put too much emphasis on participation and attendance, but at least you get some credit for showing up
He is nice professor. I would say One of the best at KSU.

This capstone class is very difficult. Dr. Blumentritt cares about the subject and about the students. However, he grades very tough and gives very few A's. He is still much better than most of the other professors that teach this course as he actually cares whereas not all professors do. Be prepared to study hard and take really good notes.

Likes to talk about his thoughts on everything. Makes participation a huge part of your grade but doesn't give lots of opportunities to participate. Nice guy, decent sense of humor, but not for everyone. Not bad, but not great.

Good guy, good prof.  Hard class.  Confusing at first, especially Capsim, but then it's a blast - especially if your team does well.  He's not an easy grader, and should not be. But as this is a mandatory class in the MBA program, he's a good bet for this class.  Do the work and you'll be OK.  Act smart; say smart things in class.
